William and Mary Diederich College of Communication Award Recipients Young Alumnus of the Year Award: DANIEL M. PUDI, COMM '01 |url=http://www.marquette.edu/alumni/awards/recipient_Pudi.php |accessdate=13 March 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130305103412/http://www.marquette.edu/alumni/awards/recipient_Pudi.php |archivedate=5 March 2013 |df= }} (born March 10, 1979){{Cite web |url=http://www.fancast.com/people/Danny-Pudi/1989056/biography/about |title=Danny Pudi Biography |publisher=Fancast |accessdate=2010-11-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119021507/http://www.fancast.com/people/Danny-Pudi/1989056/biography/about |archivedate=2010-11-19 |df= }} is an American actor and comedian, who is best known for his role as [[List of Community characters#Abed Nadir|Abed Nadir]] on the [[NBC]]/[[Yahoo!]] comedy series ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]''. ==Early years== Pudi was born in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], the son of Teresa (née Komendant), a programmer and analyst,{{cite web| url= http://www.poles.org/db/p_names/PudiKomendant_TK.html | title= Teresa K. Pudi (Komendant) | publisher= Poles.org | accessdate= 10 June 2014 }} and Abraham Pudi. His father is American of [[Indian people|Indian]] origin, and his mother is [[Polish people|Polish]] (born in [[Pokośno]], [[Poland]], to Marianna (Organek) and Boleslaw Komendant).{{cite news| url= http://www.indiacurrents.com/news/view_article.html?article_id=23821dac0d05b3f450fba42258a3e12c |title= Desis on Cable: Reshma Shetty and Danny Pudi| work= India Currents |first= Ranjit |last= Souri |date=November 2009}}{{cite news | url = http://articles.redeyechicago.com/2012-01-23/entertainment/30656694_1_twins-ken-jeong-nbc-sitcom | title= 'Community' star Danny Pudi, wife have twins | work= Show Patrol | publisher= RedEye |location= Chicago | date= 23 January 2012 |first= Curt |last= Wagner |accessdate= 10 June 2014}} Pudi grew up speaking [[Polish language|Polish]] with his mother and grandmother.{{cite news| url= http://www.marquette.edu/magazine/recent.php?subaction=showfull&id=1264489261 | title= 10 things you don’t know about Danny Pudi | publisher= Marquette University | work= Marquette Magazine | date= Spring 2004| accessdate= 10 June 2014 }} He grew up on Chicago's south side, but he attended [[Notre Dame College Prep]] in [[Niles, Illinois]],{{r|souri200911}}''[[The Bonnie Hunt Show]]'', 9 October 2009. a northern Chicago suburb. In 2013, he gave the commencement address at Notre Dame College Prep. He studied dance in Chicago and attended [[Marquette University]] in [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin|Milwaukee]], [[Wisconsin]], graduating with a degree in Communication and Theatre in 2001.{{cite news| title= Breakout star Danny Pudi was a hit at Marquette first | first= Nicole |last= Sweeney Etter | publisher= Marquette University | work= Marquette Magazine| url= http://www.marquette.edu/magazine/recent.php?subaction=showfull&id=1263573720&archive= |accessdate= 10 June 2014 }} At Marquette University, Pudi was the first winner of the [[Chris Farley]] Scholarship. Beyond paying for a year of school, the scholarship led to him performing at an [[Improvisational theatre|improv comedy]] event featuring [[Jim Breuer]] and [[Dave Chappelle]], increasing his interest in studying improv. Pudi performed in [[summer stock theatre]] in Wisconsin after Marquette, then studied at [[The Second City]] in Chicago. ==Career== Pudi became a [[recruiter]] for an [[executive search]] firm before moving to Los Angeles in 2005 to seek television and film roles.{{r|souri200911}}{{r|halverson20090916}} His [[telecommuting|home-based job]] permitted him to attend auditions, helping him avoid the "struggling actor thing in terms of waiting tables, temping and so on". He performed in several [[television pilot]]s before joining the cast of ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]''.{{r|souri200911}} Pudi has appeared in multiple [[television advertisement]]s for such products as [[Snickers]], [[Verizon]], [[McDonald's]], [[T-Mobile]], and ''[[Pokémon]]''.{{r|souri200911}}{{r|halverson20090916}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/37932/community-member-becomes-one-knights-badassdom|title=Escape with Melanie Light's Latest Short Film - Dread Central|date=29 September 2012|publisher=}} In 2012, he appeared as a celebrity contestant on [[Game Show Network|GSN]]'s version of ''The Pyramid'' with fellow ''Community'' cast member [[Yvette Nicole Brown]]. He portrayed Arash in the comedy film ''[[Road Trip: Beer Pong]]'',[http://themovingpicture.net/trailer-for-road-trip-ii-beer-pong-arrives] {{dead link|date=May 2018}} which received mainly negative reviews, and starred in the comedy horror film ''[[Knights of Badassdom]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/20518|title='Community' Funnyman Grabs His Sword for 'Knights of Badassdom'! - Bloody Disgusting!|date=9 June 2010|publisher=}} which was one of the highlights of [[San Diego Comic-Con International|Comic Con]] 2011, according to [[HitFix]].com. He starred in the Jones Street Station music video for "The Understanding".{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72LOA6WqHh4&feature=youtu.be|title=Jones Street Station "The Understanding"|date=11 August 2011|publisher=[[YouTube]]}} He has made [[cameo appearance]]s in many internet videos, including [[BriTANicK]]'s "A Monologue for Three". Pudi had a cameo appearance in ''[[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]]'', and the live episode of ''[[Hot in Cleveland]]''. In the fall of 2014, Pudi appeared in the [[Off-Broadway]] musical ''FOUND''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.theatermania.com/new-york-city-theater/news/08-2014/atlantic-found-casting-announced_69497.html|title=Community Star Danny Pudi and More Cast in New Musical Found|work=TheaterMania.com|access-date=2018-03-28}} In February 2017, Pudi began his role as Teddy on the NBC sitcom ''[[Powerless (TV series)|Powerless]]''. In 2017, Pudi is currently voicing Huey in the ''[[DuckTales (2017 TV series)|DuckTales]]'' reboot.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/12/ducktales-david-tennant-danny-pudi-ben-schwartz-voice-cast-disney-xd-reboot-1201872151/|title=‘DuckTales’: David Tennant, Danny Pudi, Ben Schwartz Among Voice Cast For Disney XD Reboot|first=Denise|last=Petski|date=16 December 2016|website=Deadline.com|accessdate=19 May 2018}} ==Personal life== Pudi is married to Bridget Showalter.{{cite news| url=http://freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~nicklaus/articles/farrell/show_linusfam_obit.txt | title= Weddings; Showalter-Pudi | work= Telegraph - Herald |date= 8 October 2004 | location= Dubuque, Iowa |accessdate= 10 June 2014}} They met while attending Marquette University their freshman year.Halverson, Steve. "[http://www.dyersvillecommercial.com/article.cfm?id=159184 'Community' star has ties to Dyersville]" ''Dyersville Commercial'', 16 September 2009.{{r|souri200911}} Their twins were born in January 2012.
